parts.text:
Requirement: Whenever a test will be performed by the maintenance staff the possibility of maintenance induced faults shall not be allowed.
Does this requirement make sense?

The original requirement, "Whenever a test will be performed by the maintenance staff the possibility of maintenance induced faults shall not be allowed," aims for an ideal state but is practically impossible to guarantee or verify. It's an absolute.

A refined version would be: "The system design and associated maintenance procedures shall incorporate features and processes to minimize the risk of maintenance-induced faults (MIFs) during tests performed by maintenance staff."

This revised requirement is more realistic, actionable, and verifiable by focusing on risk minimization through design and procedural safeguards.

args.request: Whenever a test will be performed by the maintenance staff the possibility of maintenance induced faults shall not be allowed.
